Sam DiBella
editingwriting

I am a media researcher, interested in the changing social role of anonymity and the prevention of online harassment. I will be joining the University of Maryland iSchool as a PhD student this fall. My MSc dissertation research at LSE, “The Uncertain Decorum of Online Identification”, is here. I was a founding member of the Cypurr Collective and have faciliated digital security trainings and cryptoparties since 2016.

From 2015 on, I have worked as a freelance and in-house editor at academic publishers and newsrooms. I have edited works on mathematics, medicine, art history, finance, and philosophy.

—Sam
